newsitem.title: JAPAN: ATHLETICS-JAPAN'S SHIMIZU WINS TOKYO MARATHON.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-JAPAN'S SHIMIZU WINS TOKYO MARATHON.

text.p: Japanese men captured the first four places in the Tokyo International Marathon on Sunday with the unknown Koji Shimizu winning his first major title in 2 hours, 10 minutes, 9 seconds.

Shimizu, who runs for a corporate team in central Japan, grabbed first place from Takahiro Hattori at the 39-km (24-mile) mark and never relinquished the lead on a warm sunnny day in the Japanese capital.
Hattori finished second, 12 seconds behind, followed by Shinji Kawashima at 2:11:13 and former world champion Hiromi Taniguchi at 2:11:26.
Top finishing international runners were Osmiro Silva of Brazil, who finished fifth at 2:11:58 and Valdenor Dos-Santos, also of Brazil, who came in sixth at 2:12:48.
